#Text=' Birther King ' announces 2016 campaign for U.S. president
#Text=Sunday , August 16 , 2015
#Text=Via press release

#Text=on Friday , Andy Martin , a perennial candidate for political office and self-proclaimed " Birther King " , announced he is seeking the U.S. Republican Party 's 2016 presidential nomination , his fourth bid for the White House .

column1: #Text=In his announcement and subsequent release , Martin expresses a desire to participate in Republican presidential debates and aligns himself with fellow Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump .
#Text=Additionally , he outlines six reasons for running , including degrading the candidacy of former Florida governor Jeb Bush , who is also seeking the Republican nomination .
#Text=" Birther King " Andy Martin .
#Text=Image : Andy Martin .
#Text=" I have been a loyal Republican , " says Martin in his announcement , " loyal to the principles of our party but not necessarily loyal to some of its failed leaders . "

#Text=Martin , best known for spreading multiple conspiracy theories concerning the birth and religion of U.S. President Barack Obama , previously ran for the Democratic Party presidential nomination in 1988 , and unsuccessfully sought the backing of the Republican Party in 2000 and 2012 .
#Text=In 2012 , he received a total of 19 votes in the New Hampshire Primary , the only primary ballot on which he appeared .
#Text=For 2016 , Martin does not harbor high expectations of electoral success , though he hopes to receive an invitation to the debates .
#Text=In reference to the seventeen candidates invited to the two August 6 Fox News debates , Martin casts himself as the " eighteenth candidate , " willing to participate in the second-tier debate .
#Text=Moreover , he declares himself as the " second-most exciting " candidate , reserving first place for Trump , whom Martin praises throughout his announcement .

#Text=Although he described Trump 's previous foray into politics as a " charade " during a 2011 interview with Wikinews , Martin now sees himself as Trump 's " tag team " partner in attacking the Bush candidacy .

column1: #Text=" Trump has the raw media power to weaken Bush , " says Martin , " I have the negative information and hardball media tactics to make Bush a toxic candidate for the Republican base . "
#Text=Martin adamantly opposes Bush because of the foreign policy of the candidate 's brother , former President George W. Bush .

#Text=He also criticizes Bush for his alleged economic benefit from the collapse of Lehman Brothers , labeling Bush as a " front man for a handful of corrupt plutocrats that have raped [ the nation 's ] economy . "
#Text=Martin has previously criticized the Bush family during his 2000 campaign , when he ran television ads accusing then-presidential candidate George W. Bush of abusing cocaine and alcohol .

#Text=In addition to preventing Bush from gaining the Republican nomination , Martin intends to focus his campaign on protecting the prestige of the New Hampshire Primary and Iowa Caucus , defending the economic legacy of Founding Father Alexander Hamilton , combating political correctness , emphasizing U.S. relations with Greece , and fighting political corruption .
#Text=Martin filed paperwork with the Federal Election Commission last month to run for president in 2016 officially .
#Text=He joins 139 other Republican Party presidential candidates who have done likewise .
